short-title.#text:
Geothermal Exploration and Technology
			 Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

In
			 this section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Geothermal Exploration and Technology Act of 2013/s:2/ss:h

term.#tail: means the Geothermal Investment Fund established under

text.#text:
The
			 term

term.#tail:
means the direct loan program for high risk
			 geothermal exploration wells established under this section.

text.#text:
The
			 term

The

shall establish a direct loan program for high risk geothermal exploration
			 wells.

text.#text: The

an application for the loan at such time, in such form, and

may prescribe.

text.#text:
An

text.#text:
In selecting applicants for loans under this section to
			 carry out projects under the program, the

the expertise and

the importance of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide a preference for projects likely to
			 lead to successful new geothermal development leading to electricity

text.#text:
In
			 selecting applicants for loans under this section to carry out projects under
			 the program, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

for use in mapping national geothermal resources and other uses,

text.#text:
Data from all exploratory wells that are carried out

subsurface

metadata;

borehole

inclusion in the
			 National Geothermal Data System of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall determine the cost share for a loan
			 made under this section.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may base the cost share percentage for loans
			 made under this section on a sliding scale, with higher Federal shares awarded
			 to projects with higher risks.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall determine the number of wells for each
			 selected geothermal project for which a loan may be made under this
			 section.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may grant further delays or dispense with
			 the repayment obligation on a demonstration that a selected geothermal project
			 is unproductive.

text.#text: The

The
			 recipient of a loan made under this section for a geothermal facility shall
			 commence repayment of the loan beginning on the earlier of—

the date that is
			 4 years after the date the loan is made; or

the date on which
			 the geothermal facility enters into commercial production.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the term of a
			 loan made under this section shall be 4 years beginning on the applicable loan
			 repayment commencement date under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Geothermal Exploration and Technology Act of 2013/s:2/ss:g/p:2/sp:B
Geothermal Exploration and Technology Act of 2013/s:2/ss:g/p:1

text.#text: Except as provided in

may extend the term of a loan under this section for not more than 4

text.#text: The

Amounts repaid on loans made under this section shall
			 be deposited in the Fund.

There is established in the Treasury of the United States
			 a fund to be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to be available without fiscal year limitation
			 and not subject to appropriation, to carry out this section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Geothermal Exploration and Technology Act of 2013/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by inserting after
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Title VI of
			 the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/t:VI

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:616

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds that—

of
				the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy

text.#text:
the Geothermal
				Technologies Program of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of
				the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy

text.#text:
the Building
				Technologies Program of the

is focused on the
				energy demand and energy efficiency of buildings; and

includes
				geothermal heat pumps as a component technology in the residential and
				commercial deployment activities of the program; and

geothermal heat
				pumps and direct use of geothermal energy, especially in large-scale
				applications, can make a significant contribution to the use of renewable
				energy but are underrepresented in research, development, demonstration, and
				commercialization.
The purposes of this section are—

to improve the
				components, processes, and systems used for geothermal heat pumps and the
				direct use of geothermal energy; and

to increase the
				energy efficiency, lower the cost, increase the use, and improve and
				demonstrate the applicability of geothermal heat pumps to, and the direct use
				of geothermal energy in, large buildings, commercial districts, residential
				communities, and large municipal, agricultural, or industrial projects.
In this section:

term.#tail:
means systems that use water that is at a temperature between
				approximately 38 degrees Celsius and 149 degrees Celsius directly or through a
				heat exchanger to provide—

text.#text: The term

heating to
				buildings; or

heat required for
				industrial processes, agriculture, aquaculture, and other facilities.

term.#tail:
means a system
				that provides heating and cooling by exchanging heat from shallow ground or
				surface water using—

text.#text: The term

a closed loop
				system, which transfers heat by way of buried or immersed pipes that contain a
				mix of water and antifreeze; or

an open loop
				system, which circulates ground or surface water directly into the building and
				returns the water to the same aquifer or surface water source.

term.#tail:
means
				an application for space or process heating or cooling for large entities with
				a name-plate capacity, expected resource, or rating of 10 or more megawatts,
				such as a large building, commercial district, residential community, or a
				large municipal, agricultural, or industrial project.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , acting through the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Assistant Secretary for Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy

text.#text:
The
				term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a program of research,
				development, demonstration, and commercial application for geothermal heat
				pumps and the direct use of geothermal energy.

text.#text: The

The
				program may include research, development, demonstration, and commercial
				application of—

geothermal ground
				loop installation cost reduction through—

improved drilling
				methods;

improvements in
				drilling equipment;

improvements in
				design methodology and energy analysis procedures; and

improved methods
				for determination of ground thermal properties and ground temperatures;

using gray or
				black wastewater as a method of heat exchange;

improving
				geothermal heat pump system economics through integration of geothermal systems
				with other building systems, including providing hot and cold water and
				rejecting or circulating industrial process heat through refrigeration heat
				rejection and waste heat recovery;

advanced
				geothermal systems using variable pumping rates to increase efficiency;

geothermal heat
				pump efficiency improvements;

heating of
				districts, neighborhoods, communities, large commercial or public buildings
				(including office, retail, educational, government, and institutional buildings
				and multifamily residential buildings and campuses), and industrial and
				manufacturing facilities;

geothermal system
				integration with solar thermal water heating or cool roofs and
				solar-regenerated desiccants to balance loads and use building hot water to
				store geothermal energy;

use of hot water
				coproduced from oil and gas recovery;

system
				integration of direct use with geothermal electricity production; and

coproduction of
				heat and power, including on-site use.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall identify
				and mitigate potential environmental impacts in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:614/ss:c

text.#text: In carrying out the program, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall make grants available to State and
				local governments, institutions of higher education, nonprofit entities,
				utilities, and for-profit companies (including manufacturers of heat-pump and
				direct-use components and systems) to promote the development of geothermal
				heat pumps and the direct use of geothermal energy.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall give priority to
				proposals that apply to large buildings (including office, retail, educational,
				government, institutional, and multifamily residential buildings and campuses
				and industrial and manufacturing facilities), commercial districts, and
				residential communities.

text.#text:
In
				making grants under this subsection, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a national solicitation for
				applications for grants under this section.

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment
				of this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to the
and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on progress
				made and results obtained under this section to develop geothermal heat pumps
				and direct use of geothermal energy.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on
				Science and Technology of the House of Representatives

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To promote the mapping and development of United States
		  geothermal resources by establishing a direct loan program for high risk
		  geothermal exploration wells, to amend the Energy Independence and Security Act
		  of 2007 to improve geothermal energy technology and demonstrate the use of
		  geothermal energy in large scale thermal applications, and for other
		  purposes.
